item.description:
Fenway and the New Generation of Ballparks
with Janet Marie Smith
Senior Vice President of Planning and Development
Boston Red Sox

Don't miss this chance to hear Fenway Park architect Janet Marie Smith talk abut the evolution of ballpark design and how the Red Sox have brought modern improvements to Fenway -- the oldest park in the major leagues -- while preserving its historic charm. Before joining the Red Sox, Smith was involved in the planning and development of Atlanta?s Turner Field and Baltimore?s Camden Yards, regarded as the gold standard of modern ballparks.

This program is free. Seating passes available first come, first served in the Museum lobby beginning at 5:45 p.m. the evening of the program.


The Museum of Science thanks the Boston Society of Architects for its support of "Fenway and the New Generation of Ballparks."
item.name: Fenway and the New Generation of Ballparks
